full_text:
Sarah is in her 80s now and not well. I don't want to say more  
because I have not spoken to her family, just a mutual friend.



Ann

> hadn't heard she is sick or anything . . . what's going on with  
> her? I'd like to send out Prayers her way! Thanks. =Judy=
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:

> > Sarah is such a brave visionary. Jen & I met her at the Atlanta

> >

> > Bill

> > >
> > > As most of us know, Sarah Estep, was the founder of the AA-EVP-- 
> the
> > > route by I, and many of us, first got to the place we're at today.
> > > I've heard from a friend of mine who is also of that generation of
> > > EVP tapers, that Sarah's condition is deteriorating. I'd like  
> to ask
> > > all of you to send positive thoughts her way, as she was always a
> > > very gracious lady who was more than helpful to many, many people
> > who
> > > were interested in taping. I bought my first equipment from  
> Sarah's
> > > husband and benefited greatly from her wisdom, always given  
> freely.
> > > She will be remembered as giant in this field.
> > >
> > > Please think of her kindly this Christmas Eve.
> > >
> > > Ann
> > >
> >
